sen.j: 宝ヶ池公園（たからがいけこうえん）は、京都府京都市左京区にある公園。
sen.e: Takaragaike-koen Park is located in Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Takaragaike-koen Park is located in Sakyo Ward in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Takaragaike-koen Park is located in Sakyo Ward in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 園域は宝ヶ池を中心に国立京都国際会館、グランドプリンスホテルに隣接する。
sen.e: The area of this park is surrounded by adjacent Kyoto International Conference Center and Grand Prince Hotel Kyoto.
The area is surrounded by the adjacent Kyoto International Conference Center and Grand Prince Hotel Kyoto.
The area is surrounded by the adjacent Kyoto International Conference Center and Grand Prince Hotel Kyoto.

sen.j: 宝ヶ池は江戸時代に農業用のため池として作られた人口池である。
sen.e: Takaraga-ike Pond was built as an agricultural irrigation pond in Edo Period.
Takaraga-ike Pond was built as an agricultural irrigation pond in the Edo Period.
Takaragaike Pond was built as an agricultural irrigation pond in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: periodの頭文字を小文字に変更、ハイフンをとりTakaragaike Pondとしました。

sen.j: それを市民の憩いの場として利用するために宝ヶ池公園が作られた。
sen.e: Takaraga-ike Park was built to make use of this pond for recreation of the people in the city.
Takaraga-ike Park was built for the people of the city to make use of this pond for recreation.
sen.cmt: 「of the people in the city」→「for the people of the city」箇所異動
sen.e: Takaragaike-koen Park was built for the people of the city to make use of this pond for recreation.
sen.cmt: 前出の表記に合わせ、Takaragaike-koen Parkとしました。

sen.j: 比叡山と国立京都国際会館を借景として楽しむ遊歩道とボート遊びが出来る本体部と、山を越えて京都市営地下鉄烏丸線松ヶ崎駅側にある運動公園、子供向けの遊戯施設がある「こどもの楽園」と、本体部とこどもの楽園を結ぶ「いこいの森」部分から成り立つ。
sen.e: This park consists of several areas: a walking trail with the backdrop of Hiei-zan Mountain and Kyoto International Conference Center; the pond on which people enjoy rowing boats; an athletic park on the other side of the hill and at the side of Matsugasaki Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line; "Kodomo no Rakuen" (Paradise of Children) which has play facilities for children; and "Ikoi no Mori" (Recreation Woods) that links the pond and Kodomo no Rakuen.

This park consists of several areas: a walking trail with Hiei-zan Mountain and Kyoto International Conference Center as a backdrop, the pond on which people can enjoy rowing boats, an athletic park on the other side of the hill and at the side of Matsugasaki Station on Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, "Kodomo no Rakuen" (Children's Paradise) which has play facilities for children, and "Ikoi no Mori" (Recreation Woods) that links the pond and Kodomo no Rakuen.
sen.cmt: 「the backdrop of」→「as a background」箇所異動,「can」挿入, 「of」→「on」, 「Paradise of Children」→「Children's Paradise」, 「;」→「,」x4
sen.e: This park consists of several areas: a walking trail with Mt. Hiei and Kyoto International Conference Center as a backdrop, the pond on which people can enjoy rowing boats, an athletic park on the other side of the hill and at the side of Matsugasaki Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line, 'Kodomo no Rakuen' (Children's Paradise) which has play facilities for children, and 'Ikoi no Mori' (Recreation Woods) that links the pond and Kodomo no Rakuen.
sen.cmt: Hiei-zan Mountain→Mt. Hieiに修正、"the"を入れ"on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line"とし、クォーテーションをシングルおよび半角に変更しました。

sen.j: 四季を通じて花の名所であるように設計されており、特に春の桜の時期は非常に混雑する。
sen.e: It is designed to enjoy flowers throughout the year, and it is very crowded in the spring week of cherry blossoms.
It is designed so that people can enjoy flowers throughout the year, and it is very crowded in the spring when the cherry blossoms are out.
sen.cmt: 「to」→「so that people can」, 「week of cherry blossoms」→「when the cherry blossoms are out」
sen.e: It is designed so that people can enjoy flowers throughout the year, and it is very crowded in the spring when the cherry blossoms are out.

sen.j: 野鳥観察の施設もあり京都市内とは思えないほど自然に溢れている。
sen.e: It is rich in natural environment with a facility for watching birds making people forget they are in Kyoto City.
Its rich natural environment containing a facility for watching birds can make people forget they are in Kyoto City.
Its rich natural environment containing a facility for watching birds can make people forget they are in Kyoto City.

sen.j: また、池の周囲の遊歩道では近辺の市立小中学校のマラソン大会が恒例行事となったり、ジョギングをする者も少なくない。
sen.e: Many people enjoy jogging on the walking trail around the pond, where neighboring primary schools and junior high schools hold annual long-distance running competitions.
Many people enjoy jogging on the walking trail around the pond, where neighboring primary schools and junior high schools hold annual long-distance running competitions.
Many people enjoy jogging on the walking trail around the pond, where neighboring primary schools and junior high schools hold annual long-distance running competitions.

sen.j: こどもの楽園はかつて京都競輪場（宝ヶ池競輪場）であったが、競輪場廃止にともない改築され作られた。
sen.e: In the area Kodomo no Rakuen lies, there used to be Kyoto Bicycle Racing Track (Takaragaike Keirin Track) which was transformed to the park after the bicycle racing was abolished.
In the area in which Kodomo no Rakuen lies, there used to be Kyoto Bicycle Racing Track (Takaragaike Keirin Track) which became part of the park after bicycle racing was discontinued.
sen.cmt: 「in which」挿入, 「was transformed to the」→「became part of the」, 「the」削除,「abolished」→「discontinued」
sen.e: In the area in which Kodomo no Rakuen lies, there used to be Kyoto Bicycle Racing Track (Takaragaike Keirin Track) which became part of the park after bicycle racing was discontinued.

sen.j: 2006年までは競輪観戦用のベンチスタンドが残されていたが、老朽化により取り壊された。
sen.e: Bleachers for spectators of the bicycle racing had been left out until 2006 when they were dismantled because of becoming too old.
Bleachers for spectators of the bicycle racing remained until 2006 when they were dismantled after becoming too old.
Bleachers for spectators of the bicycle racing remained until 2006 when they were dismantled after becoming too old.

sen.j: 京都市宝が池公園運動施設球技場 – 京都市左京区松ヶ崎西池ノ内町
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Takaragaike Park Ball Game Stadium: Matsugasaki Nishiikeno Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
sen.cmt: 京都市宝が池公園運動施設球技場→Takaragaike Stadium→Kyoto Municipal Takaragaike Park Ball Game Stadium[定訳不明]
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Takaragaike Park Ball Game Stadium: Matsugasaki Nishiikeno Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Kyoto Municipal Takaragaike Park Ball Game Stadium: Nishiikenouchi-cho, Matsugasaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 関西の大学対抗ラグビーなどの試合場としても知られる。
sen.e: It is also known for inter-college rugby tournaments in Kansai (Kyoto, Osaka and neighboring prefectures) area.
It is also known for inter-college rugby tournaments in the Kansai (Kyoto, Osaka and neighboring prefectures) area.
It is also known for inter-college rugby tournaments in the Kansai (Kyoto, Osaka and neighboring prefectures) area.

sen.j: 宝ヶ池こどもの楽園 – 京都市左京区上高野竜田町
sen.e: Takaragaike Kodomo no Rakuen: Kamitakano Nagareda Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Takaragaike Kodomo no Rakuen: Kamitakano Nagareda Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Takaragaike Kodomo no Rakuen: Nagareda-cho, Kamitakano, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 1950年に市営競輪場として開設されたが、当時の京都市議会から市営によるギャンブル施設運営に対する異議が相次いだ為に1955年に閉鎖後、中学生以上は立入禁止（保護者を除く）の公園として整備される。
sen.e: In 1950, the municipal bicycle racing track was built in this place, but because then city council opposed to the public operation of a gambling facility many times, it was closed in 1955, and was transformed to a park where older than junior high students (except for parents) were not admitted.

In 1950 the municipal bicycle racing track was built here, but because the then city council was opposed to the public operation of a gambling facility, it was closed in 1955, and was transformed into a park where, except for parents, people older than junior high school students are not admitted.
sen.cmt: 「,」削除, 「in this place」→「here」, 「the」挿入,「was」挿入,「many times」削除,「where older than junior high school students (except for parents) were」→「, except for parents, people older than junior high school students are」
sen.e: In 1950 the municipal bicycle racing track was built here, but because the then city council was opposed to the public operation of a gambling facility, it was closed in 1955, and was transformed into a park where, except for parents, people older than junior high school students were not admitted.

sen.j: 園内には最近まで競輪所時代の場内スタンドの一部が残されていたが、老朽化のため取り壊された。
sen.e: Some bleachers of bicycle racing track facility had been left out in the park until recent days, but they were dismantled because they became too old.
Some bleachers of bicycle racing track facility remained in the park until recent days, but they were dismantled because they became too old.
Some bleachers of bicycle racing track facility remained in the park until recent days, but they were dismantled because they became too old.

sen.j: いこいの森 - 京都市左京区岩倉大鷺町
sen.e: Ikoi no Mori: Iwakuraosagi Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Ikoi no Mori: Iwakuraosagi Cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Ikoi no Mori: Osagi-cho, Iwakura, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 平安騎馬隊所属馬の厩舎がある。
sen.e: Horse stables of Heian Kibatai (平安騎馬隊) (Kyoto Police Cavalry) are in this place.
sen.cmt: 平安騎馬隊→Heian Kibatai/Kyoto Police Cavalry（平安騎馬隊）[定訳不明]
sen.e: The horse stables of Heian Kibatai (平安騎馬隊) can be found here.
sen.cmt: 「The」挿入, 「are in this place」→「can be found here」
sen.e: The horse stables of Heian Kibatai (Kyoto Police Cavalry) can be found here.

sen.j: いこいの森 - 京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線国際会館駅よりすぐ
sen.e: Ikoi no Mori: close to Kokusai Kaikan Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
Ikoi no Mori: close to Kokusai Kaikan Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
Ikoi no Mori: close to Kokusai Kaikan Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line

sen.j: こどもの楽園 – 叡山電鉄宝ヶ池駅下車または、京都市営バス（5,31,65系統）、京都バス宝ヶ池バス停より徒歩3分
sen.e: Kodomo no Rakuen: three minute walk from Kyoto Bus "Takaragaike" bus stop (Route 5, 31, 65) or Takaragaike Station of Eizan Electric Railway
Kodomo no Rakuen: a three minute walk from Kyoto Bus "Takaragaike" bus stop (Route 5, 31, 65) or Takaragaike Station on the Eizan Electric Railway
Kodomo no Rakuen: a three minute walk from Kyoto Bus "Takaragaike" bus stop (Route 5, 31, 65) or Takaragaike Station on the Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 運動施設球技場 - 市営地下鉄烏丸線松ヶ崎駅より徒歩5分
sen.e: Ball Game Stadium: Five minute walk from Matsugasaki Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
Ball Game Stadium: a five minute walk from Matsugasaki Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
Ball Game Stadium: a five minute walk from Matsugasaki Station on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除
